title.narrative: 8.2.1- DEMANDE DE SERVICES Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH)

description.narrative: Communities end open defecation and households improve their latrines, practice household water treatment and adopt handwashing with soap., which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Women and children have access to drinking water, to improved sanitation, and they adopt good hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities end open defecation and households improve their latrines, practice household water treatment and adopt handwashingwith soap.

description.narrative: 2,151 communities end open defecation, more than 100,000 households improve their latrines and are practicing handwashing with soap at the keys moments | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/01/2017

title.narrative: Number of persons having access to treated water at home with Sur'Eau

actual.value: 2017:Despite Unicef and Government effort, Chlorine solution is not yet available for the promotion of Household Water Treatment and Safe Storage (HWTS).

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) additional number of people with access to an improved drinking water source in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support

actual.value: 2017:A total of 164463 (In 2016, 39500 additional persons and 9600 pupils) gains access to improved water source

title.narrative: Number of households in certified ODF villages having access to handwashing facilities with soap

actual.value: 2017:More than 100000 living in ODH villages have handwashing facilities with soap

title.narrative: Number of certified ODF villages

actual.value: 2017:Between 2014-2016, 2151 new communities were certified open defecation free (ODF).

title.narrative: Number of persons living in certified ODF villages

actual.value: 2017:738000 persons are living in ODF communities

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Additional number of people with access to sanitation in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support

actual.value: 2017:In 2016, more than 38 000 person are living in 119 new open defecation free (ODF) communities. Thus, since 2014, 738 000 person gains access to sanitation
